de.malkusch.whoisServerList.publicSuffixList.util

Class PunycodeAutoDecoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.malkusch.whoisServerList.publicSuffixList.util.PunycodeAutoDecoder

  • @NotThreadSafe
public final class PunycodeAutoDecoder
extends Object
    Automatic Punycode Codec. This codec remembers at decode(String) whether the input was encoded or not. The recode(String) method will return the same format as the original input was. This object has a state.
    Author:
    markus@malkusch.de
    See Also:
    Donations

      PunycodeAutoDecoder()

      String decode(String domain)
      Decodes a domain name into UTF-8 if it is in Punycode ASCII.

      Whether the original format was Punnycode ASCII.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PunycodeAutoDecoder

        public PunycodeAutoDecoder()

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        public String decode(String domain)
        Decodes a domain name into UTF-8 if it is in Punycode ASCII. If the domain name was already UTF-8 nothing will happen. This method saves the original format (Punycode or UTF-8) in decoded. recode(String) can return the string in the saved format.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain name, may be null
        Returns:
        the UTF-8 domain name

      • recode

        public String recode(String domain)
        Returns the UTF-8 domain name in the original format. The original format is whether Punycode ASCII or UTF-8. The format is determined in decode(String).
        Parameters:
        domain - the UTF-8 domain name, not null
        Returns:
        the domain name in the original format, not null

      • isConverted

        public boolean isConverted()
        Whether the original format was Punnycode ASCII. The original format is determined in decode(String).
        Returns:
        true if the original format was Punnycode ASCII
